pageContext.claim: “Well, you just saw other countries were doing much better than all other major countries, peer countries.”
pageContext.analysis: The United States is hardly a model for coronavirus response. On the list of the 20 hardest-hit countries, it ranks sixth in the key metric of deaths per 100,000 people, and has recorded the most cases of any country. Public health experts say U.S. officials from the president on down have struggled to contain the spread of the virus because of lax and inconsistent guidance, such as Trump denigrating mask-wearing and falsely claiming that 85 percent of people who wear them contract the disease.
